description: This class will introduce you to sociological research of Asian Americans and engage in the "model minority" stereotype. We begin by a brief introduction toU.S. immigration history and sociological theories about assimilation and racial stratification. The class will also cover research on racial and ethnic identity, educational stratification, mass media images, interracial marriage, multiracials, transracial adoption, and the viability of an Asian American panethnic identity. We will also examine the similarities and differences of Asian Americans relative to other minority groups.
name: ASIAN AMER IN CONTEMP SO

values.comments:
Sociology 103 offers an introduction to sociological research of Asian Americans and an exploration of the "model minority" stereotype. The class covers research on racial and ethnic identity, educational stratification, mass media images, interracial marriage, multiracial individuals, transracial adoption, and the viability of an Asian American panethnic identity. 

Students reported learning a lot from this course. Students felt the course material was "very interesting" and "relevant."  

Students enjoyed Professor Kao's lecture style. She was "engaging" and "conveyed the material well."

Students found the coursework to be manageable. One student reported that "there was not too much work or reading assigned."
